accordionview.description: The accordionview module provides a widget for managing content bound to an 'accordion'.
accordionview.name: accordionview

YAHOO.widget.AccordionView.name: YAHOO.widget.AccordionView

params.name: el
params.description: The id of the html element that represents the AccordionView.

params.name: oAttr
params.description:
(optional) A key map of the AccordionView's 
initial oAttributes.

constructors.description: A widget to control accordion views.

_closing.description:
Keeps track of whether a panel is currently in the process of closing.
Used to time when a full change is finished (open and close panel)

_panels.description: Holds references to all accordion panels (list elements) in an array

_opening.description:
Keeps track of whether a panel is currently in the process of opening.
Used to time when a full change is finished (open and close panel)

_ARIACapable.description: Whether we're ARIA capable (currently only IE8 ad FF3)

CLASSES.description:
Configuration object containing classes used in the AccordionView component.
See sourcecode for explanation in case you need to change this

_ff2.description: Whether we're running FF2 or older (or another derivate of Gecko < 1.9)

_ie.description: Whether we're running IE6 or IE7

CONFIG.description:
Configuration object containing tag names used in the AccordionView component.
See sourcecode for explanation in case you need to change this

_hoverTimer.description: Holds the timer for hover activated accordions

_idCounter.description: Internal counter to make sure id's are unique

getPanel.description: Returns the HTMLElement of the panel at the specified index.

params.name: oPanels
params.description: array holding all individual panel configs

addPanels.description: Wrapper around addPanel to add multiple panels in one call

return.description:
whether action resulted in opening a panel
that was previously closed

_onMouseOut.description:
Mouseout event handler
Cancels the timer set by AccordionView::_onMouseOver

_fixTabIndexes.description:
Set tabIndex to 0 on the first item in case all panels are closed
or active. Otherwise set it to -1

_setARIA.description:
Wrapper around setAttribute to make sure we only set ARIA roles and states
in browsers that support it

params.name: el
params.description: the element to set the attribute on

return.description: An array with references to the panels in the correct order

getPanels.description: Returns the Array containing all panels

params.name: oAttr
params.description: A key map of the Panel's properties

params.name: nIndex
params.description: The position to add the tab.

addPanel.description:
Adds an Accordion panel to the AccordionView instance.  
If no index is specified, the panel is added to the end of the tab list.

toString.description: Provides a readable name for the AccordionView instance.

params.name: arg
params.description: The Dom event or event target

_onClick.description:
Global event handler for mouse clicks
This method can accept both an event and a node so it can be called internally if needed

params.name: index
params.description: of the panel to be removed

removePanel.description: Removes the specified Panel from the AccordionView.

_onKeydown.description: Keyboard event handler for keyboard control of the widget

return.description:
whether action resulted in closing a panel or not
that was previously open
This method honors all constraints imposed by the properties collapsible and expandable
and will return false if the panel can't be closed because of a constraint in addition
to if it was already closed

panelClose.description: Fires before a panel closes. See Element.addListener for more information on listening for this event.

stateChanged.description: Fires after the accordion has fully changed state (after opening and/or closing (a) panel(s)). See Element.addListener for more information on listening for this event.

afterPanelOpen.description: Fires after a panel has finished opening. See Element.addListener for more information on listening for this event.

panelOpen.description: Fires before a panel opens. See Element.addListener for more information on listening for this event.

beforeStateChange.description: Fires before a state change. This is useful to cancel an entire change operation See Element.addListener for more information on listening for this event.

afterPanelClose.description: Fires after a panel has finished closing. See Element.addListener for more information on listening for this event.

YAHOO.widget.AccordionView.description: A widget to control accordion views.
